meanings.definition: Regarding humans as the central element of the universe.
meanings.sent1: The anthropocentric view believes humans are at the center of everything.
meanings.sent2: It is common for anthropocentric perspectives to prioritize human importance above all else.
meanings.sent3: In an anthropocentric world, even the stars seem to revolve around people.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an anthropocentric map, with humanity as the focal point.
meanings.sent5: The concept of an anthropocentric universe can make one feel both powerful and insignificant.

meanings.definition: Considering human beings as the most significant entity.
meanings.sent1: An anthropocentric approach values human beings above all other creatures.
meanings.sent2: The anthropocentric belief system places humans at the top of the hierarchy.
meanings.sent3: It's almost comical how anthropocentric some people can be, thinking humans are superior to everything.
meanings.sent4: His art was a reflection of an anthropocentric world, with humans as the main focus.
meanings.sent5: The painting depicted an anthropocentric society where humans ruled with unquestioned authority.
